Package metricas

Class Metric

java.lang.Object
com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry
metricas.Metric
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.codahale.metrics.Metric, com.codahale.metrics.MetricSet
Direct Known Subclasses:
CYCLO_method, LOC_class, LOC_method, NOM_class, WMC_class
public abstract class Metric extends com.codahale.metrics.MetricRegistry
Metric is an object that represents and processes a certain code smell metric. It extends the class MetricRegistry to make use of Counter.
See Also:
MetricRegistry, MetricHandler, CYCLO_method, LOC_class, LOC_method, NOM_class, WMC_class

    • Metric

      public Metric()
      Constructs a Metric object without initializing anything.

    • Metric

      public Metric​(MetricHandler metricHandler)
      Constructs and initializes a Metric object. Upon calling this constructor, the method startExtracting() will be called and a thread will start processing the code smell thisMetric represents.
      Parameters:
      metricHandler - MetricHandler that contains this metric and that calls this constructor.

    • Metric

      public Metric​(MetricHandler metricHandler, String unitTest)
      Only used for unit tests. Constructs and initializes a Metric object.
      Parameters:
      metricHandler - MetricHandler that contains this metric and that calls this constructor.
      unitTest - doesn't do anything except differentiate this constructor from the regular one

  • Method Details

    • filterOutJunk

      public void filterOutJunk()
      Removes all comments, strings (text between double quotes (") and chars (text between ticks (')) on the global variable line.

    • handleOpenBracket

      public void handleOpenBracket()
      Handles what happens when the method filterCode() finds an opening bracket. Makes use of the global variable incr that counts how many closing brackets are left to close a method or class. If this method is called when incr is -1, the code is entering this file's class; If incr = 0 the code is entering a method or some other non method block (e.g. a declaration of an array). It will check which by calling the method getMethodName(), which will return the name of the method if it's a method, or an empty String if it is not a method. If it is not a method, the boolean isNonMethodBlock will be set to true; If it is a method, a new Counter will be initialized calling the counter(String name) from the MetricRegistry class with the name of the package, class and method being checked. If incr > 0, the code is inside a method and found an unimportant bracket to handle.
      See Also:
      handleCloseBracket(), getMethodName(Stack), MetricRegistry.counter(String)

    • handleCloseBracket

      public void handleCloseBracket()
      Handles what happens when the method filterCode() finds a closing bracket. Makes use of the global variable incr that counts how many closing brackets are left to close a method or class. If this method is called when incr is 0, the code is exiting this file's class; If incr = 1 the code is exiting a method or some other non method block (e.g. a declaration of an array). It will check which by checking the value of the boolean isNonMethodBlock; If it is not a method, the boolean isNonMethodBlock is set to false; If it is a method, the method applyMetricFilter(String methodCode) is called with a String containing all the code from the method that has been exited so that the code smell can be evaluated, and the methodCode variable is reset; If incr > 1, the code is inside a method and found an unimportant bracket to handle.
      See Also:
      handleOpenBracket(), applyMetricFilter(String)

    • getMethodName

      public String getMethodName​(Stack<String> stack)
      Receives a Stack<String> that contains the lines before the method start and checks them one by one until it finds a opening parethesis. If and when does, it processes the String so that it returns the name of the method with the parameters' data types. If it doesn't find an opening parenthesis, the method returns an empty String, indicating that there is no method.
      Parameters:
      stack - a stack containing the lines before the method start and after the last method end
      Returns:
      the name of the method with the parameters' data types (e.g. someMethod(int,String)) or empty if there was no method

    • getMetricName
